content: I think the problem could be related to "Authentication Method" : you need to know shaw.ca authentication method. If you don't know then you can try each of the option ( Normal Password .... ) to see which one will work.
creator: MichelT

content:
You shouldn't be seeing that password prompt if the outgoing (and incoming) authentication is OAuth2, but instead a browser-like window where you enter the account password to grant TB access.

outgoing smtp: smtp.gmail.com, 465, SSL/TLS, or 587, STARTTLS, OAuth2 authentication, User Name = email address
creator: sfhowes

content: There has never been a link between iphone and thunderbird. There may be that the same email account is configured in both Thunderbird and on the iphone. But the two things are not linked, anymore than placing photocopies of incoming mail in a filing cabinet and also in your in tray. same things in both places, but not in any way linked.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Spam and other filtering isn't supported yet. You can add a comment at https://connect.mozilla.org/t5/ideas/filtering-with-android-thunderbird/idi-p/61144.
creator: siffemoz

content: Generally you remove old account and that ends the requests to get new mail. But doing so will affect any mail stored in Thunderbird under that address. You need to move it elsewhere before you remove the account (like Thunderbird local folders)
creator: MattAuSupport

content: What is "messed up" seriously take the time to try and explain what it is you are trying to change. Rarely is an export of email addresses going to fix anything that can not be done through sorting or other ways of viewing the existing mail addresses.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Thunderbird non ha limiti nel numero di destinatari. Tuttavia il tuo fornitore email potrebbe averne e bloccare l'invio. Ma devi chiedere a lui. Peraltro con questi numeri ti conviene considerare un servizio di newsletter o un gruppo di discussione se non lo stai gi√† usando
creator: @next

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next
